mcm.theater
Class Actor

java.lang.Object
  mcm.graphics.Body
      mcm.theater.Actor
Direct Known Subclasses:
Bouncer, DrJava, Eraser, ShowShape, StageDump
public abstract class Actor
extends Body

Actor is the abstract base class that all actors are derived from. Derived actors must implement the act() method. An actor's start(Stage)method puts the actor on the given stage and creates and starts a new thread. The thread executes the actor's act method, which typically contains calls that change an actor's position and/or appearance, that is its Shape.

The Stage's scheduler makes sure that simultaneously executing actors advance at the same rate. It provides a clock that advances one clock tick as soon as all its actors finish their current step. Actors in turn inform their stage that they finished a step by calling their sleep()method, which suspends their excecution until the stage advances the clock. Actors call sleep() either explicitly or implicitly from within one of the move methods. If an actor's thread executes in debug mode it uses the sleep method to animate their direction changes, see setDirection(double).

Actors travel about their stage using one of the move(double), Body.jump(double), or line(double)methods. Movement is performed incrementally in steps, the size of which is determined by the actor's stepSize. Actors sleep for one clock tick between steps. An actor instantaneously jumps to a new position by calling one of the jump or line methods. Jumping does not take time and leaves no movement trail. Line methods do not consume any time and always leave a trail behind.

A visible actor shows its shape at its current position on stage while invisible actors do not. Whether an actor leaves a movement trail by drawing a line along its paths is governed by its trail visibility setting. The trail's color is determined by the actor's trail color and the trail's width by the actor's trail width.

An Actor that moves along the sides of a equilateral triangle with sides 50 pixels long can be programmed as follows: 

 class TriangleActor extends Actor {
        public void act() {
                while (true) {
                   move(50);
                   right(120);
                }
        }
 }
The following code creates a TriangleActor, positions it at the center of Stage stage, and starts its execution: 
 TriangleActor a = new TriangleActor();
 a.jumpTo(stage.getCenter());
 a.start(stage);
By default actors draw a line along their movement path. The following code changes the color and line width that Actor a uses when drawing lines: 
 a.setTrailColor(Color.GREEN);
 a.setTrailWidth(3);

Constructor Detail

Actor

public Actor()
Constructs a new Actor object. This constructor copies properties such as lineWidth, visibility, ... from the defaults actor.

See Also:
getDefault()

Actor

public Actor(Actor template)
Creates an Actor copying properties from copy.

The constructor copies the following properties from to initialize properties from the given template actor. If template is null the global defaults actor is used in its place.

Parameters:
template - the Actor from which to copy properties
See Also:
getDefault()
Method Detail

copyProps

public void copyProps(Actor template)
Copies template actor's properties from the givem template actor. The properties copied are those copied by Body.copyProps(Body) as well as:
  • step size, see setStepSize(double)
  • debug mode, see setDebugMode(boolean)
  • trail width, see setTrailWidth(int)
  • trail color, see setTrailColor(Color)
  • trail visibiliy, see setTrailVisible(boolean)
copyProps is called by Actor constructors and must be implemented by derived classes that wish to copy additional properties. Implementations of copyProps must explicitly call the implementation of super classes.

Parameters:
template - the actor template from which to copy properties

act

public void act()

An actor's act method is executed in its own thread once the actor is started. A typical act method contains method calls that change the position and/or the appearance of an actor.

When an actor is started, see start(Stage), it is added to the given stage and a new thread is started, which calls the actor's act method. While the thread executes the act method, calls to isActing()return true and calls to getStage()return a reference to the stage on which the actor was started. The actor's thread terminates once the act method finishes. The actor is removed from the stage, calls to isActing()return false, and calls to getStage()continue to return the stage on which the actor executed.

act methods must explicitly or implicitly call the sleep() method frequently so that the stage can advance its clock and update its image regularly.

isActing

public boolean isActing()
Tests whether the actor's thread is currently executing its act method.

Returns:
true if the answer is yes; false otherwise.
See Also:
act()

getStage

public Stage getStage()
Returns null or the body's stage.

Returns:
null or the body's stage

SetName

public void SetName(java.lang.String name)
Sets this actor's name.

Parameters:
name - the new name

setDebugMode

public void setDebugMode(boolean mode)
Sets the actor's debugMode. While an actor's debugMode is true it animates changes to its movement direction and it stays on its stage even after finishing its act method. By default an actor is not in debug mode.

Parameters:
mode - true or false.
See Also:
setDirection(double)

getDebugMode

public boolean getDebugMode()
Returns the actor's debug mode.

Returns:
true if the actor is in debug mode; false otherwise.
See Also:
setDirection(double)

start

public void start(Stage stage)
Starts the actor on the given stage.
This method has the same effect as calling start(s, 0);

start

public void start(Stage s,
                  int delay)
Starts the actor on the given stage with the given delay. start enters this actor on the given stage. It creates and starts a new thread which calls the actor's act method. The thread starts after the stage's clock advanced delay clock ticks if delay is greater than zero. Otherwise it starts immediately.

See Also:
sleep(int)

terminate

public void terminate()

Terminate the execution of this actor's thread. The terminate method sets a flag indicating the request that this actor's thread should terminate. As soon as this actor's thread calls one of the actor methods, that method throws an ActorDeath exception thus terminating the thread.

terminate has no effect if this actor's thread is not executing.

getDefault

public static Actor getDefault()
Returns a reference to the global default actor. Actor constructors use the default actor's properties, such as its position, direction, stepSize to initialize the properties of newly constructed actors. Be aware that there is only one global default actor that is shared by all actors.

Returns:
the default actor

resetDefaults

public static Actor resetDefaults()
Resets the default body's properties. The properties of the default Body are reset as follows:
  • The position is set to (0, 0).
  • The direction is set to 0 degrees, that is the map direction EAST.
  • The step size is set to 5.0.
  • The visibility and trail visibilty are set to true
  • The shape is set to DirectionShape with a 20 pixel diagonal
  • The trail color and shape's color is set RED
  • The trail width and shape's line width are set to 1
  • The debug mode is set to false

setDirection

public void setDirection(double angle)
Sets the actor's movement direction in degrees, Body.setDirection(double). setDirection performs in one step unless the actor is in debugMode. In that case it turns in 3 degree increments calling sleep in between.

Overrides:
setDirection in class Body
Parameters:
angle - the movement angle given in degrees

stamp

public void stamp()
Paints the shape to the Stage's backgound.

See Also:
Stage

sleep

public void sleep(int n)

Suspends the actor's thread for n ticks on its stage's clock. Sleep signals the end of one execution step to this actor's stage, which advances its clock once all its actors finish their current execution step. Sleep(1) returns when the stage advances the clock once, Sleep(n) resumes after the stage advanced the clock n times.

sleep may only be called from within an actor's act() method amd on the actor itself.

sleep

public void sleep()
Suspends the actor's thread for n ticks on its stage's clock.
This method has the same effect as sleep(1).

getStepSize

public double getStepSize()
Returns the actor's step size.

Returns:
the step size

setDrJava

public void setDrJava()
Indicates that this actor is controlled from DrJava's Interactions pane. If a user wishes to control an actor by issuing method calls from DrJava's Interactions pane, s/he must call setDrJava before starting that actor.

setStepSize

public void setStepSize(double stepSize)
Sets the actor's step size.

Parameters:
stepSize - the new step size

move

public void move(double dist)
The actor moves the given distance in its current movement direction. Movement is done in incremental movement steps. The size of each step is determined by the actor's step size. The actor calls sleep(1) in between steps.

If the actor's trail visibility is set to true it draws a line along its movement path.

Parameters:
dist - the total distance to move
See Also:
sleep(int)

moveTo

public void moveTo(double tox,
                   double toy)
The actor moves to the position given by the tox, toy coordinates. Movement is done in incremental movement steps. The size of each step is determined by the actor's step size. The actor calls sleep(1) in between steps.

Parameters:
tox - the x coordinate of the movement's destination
toy - the y coordinate of the movement's destination

moveTo

public void moveTo(Point to)
This method has the same effect as moveTo(to.x, to.y).

Parameters:
to - the position to move to

getMoveDelay

public int getMoveDelay(double dist)
Computes the number of clock ticks needed to cover the given distance. getMoveDelay computes the number of ticks on the stage's clock that need to pass for this actor to cover the given distance using its current step size.

Parameters:
dist - movement distance for which to compute the delay
Returns:
dist / stepSize if the given distance is a multiple of the actor's stepSize; otherwise 1 + dist / stepSize

lineTo

public void lineTo(double tox,
                   double toy)
Sets the body's position to point (tox, toy) and always leaves a trail along the jumped distance.

Parameters:
tox - the destination point's x coordinate
toy - the destination point's y coordinate

lineTo

public void lineTo(Point to)
Sets the body's position to the given point and always leaves a trail along the jumped distance.

Parameters:
to - the body's new position

line

public void line(double dist)
Jump the given distance from the current position in the current movement direction and always leaves a trail along the jumped distance. The body's position is set to the point at the 'end of the jump'.

setTrailVisible

public void setTrailVisible(boolean mode)
Sets the body's trail visibility to the given parameter. A body paints a line along their movement paths if their trail visibility is set to true. Otherwise they move without drawing a line along their paths.

Parameters:
mode - the trail painting mode
See Also:
move(double)
